Signed-off-by: Seequick1 morsak@redhat.com
Type of change

Enhancement / new feature
Refactoring

Description
This PR adding following changes:

deploying oauth kafka client (using in memory clients instead of pod oauth clients from examples)
refactor of OauthPlainST and OauthTlsST
adding OauthAuthorizationST, which consists of few test cases

testing write access, read access to specific topic, consumer group


adding new realm kafka-authz for authorization
added keycloak http deployment

Checklist

 Write tests
 Make sure all tests pass

nodes.bodyText: it seems to be the same code as the producer, I would suggest to factor out a common method for it.
As a general point, with something like a timeout it's worth using the parameter name to convey the units (e.g. timeoutSeconds or timeoutMs).

Additionally, unless the declared checked exception is supposed to be used somewhere up the stack to do error handling specific to the exception type I'd say it's a better practice to wrap it into a RuntimeException, and not declare it. If InterruptedException just results in ending the test, just the same way as KeyStoreException, IOException or any other RuntimeException I'd just scrap them all.

It is not quite visible here, but this method returns a resultPromise after calling get(), which means there is no asynchronicity left here. This whole method could as well be declared as:
public Integer sendMessagesTls(String topicName, String namespace, String clusterName, String kafkaUsername, int messageCount, String securityProtocol, int timeInSeconds) { ... }

It would make code that uses it easier to read.
I see many occurrences like this around the testsuite.

It would make sense to make the default value configurable somehow. A static constant with static initializer, that reads a system property maybe. Generally that goes for all the time constants. It's just several different values used around the tests, and could be replaced with just several constants initialized from system properties.
As a general note, lines like this mean you don't have trust in your error handling code or logging configuration :)

If this is to work around a bug in keycloak you should include include a link to the bug report in keycloak (and ideally watch that bug so we know when it gets fixed and this workaround can be removed)
Can you add a Javadoc to explain what this class is for, and how it differs other implementations of IKafkaClient.
This difference between this method and sendMessages above appear to be minimal: Can you factor out a common method?
Similarly, how much does this differ from the non-TLS receive? Can you factor out a common method?
Javadoc
Javadoc
A comment to say that this script is used to setup the Oauth tests would be a good idea.

You don't declare RuntimeExceptions, that's the whole beauty of them.
Simply:
T sendMessages(String topicName, String namespace, String clusterName, int messageCount, long timeoutMs) throws IOException;

will suffice.
